Create Taxonomy vocabulary

  • databasename store in taxonomy_term_field_revision table

using taxonomy vocabulary we can add a master list for category

Creation of taxonomy

  1. go to taxonomy
  2. add vocabulary
  3. add “Category”
  4. add “term”
  5. add name and save (optional description)
  6. adding this category to article
  7. go to content type
  8. select article and manage fields
  9. add field
  10. select taxonomy term
  11. enter label
  12. select unlimited
  13. select the Category in Vocabulary
  14. please make sure uncheck the “Create referenced entities if they don't already exist”
  15. save settings
  16. in manage display
  17. default the arrangment in display
  18. Teaser tab if you want to show it in the teaser (home page)

update drupal core from 8.9.0 to 8.9.18

  • composer require drupal/core-recommended:8.9.18 –update-with-dependencies
  • update.php
  • clear cache

Update 8.0 to 8.9

https://www.drupal.org/docs/installing-drupal/add-composer-to-an-existing-site

  1. sudo composer create-project drupal/recommended-project:^8.9 drupal80to89to9
  2. copy sites,modules,themes to fresh install 8.9
  3. copy provisioning vagrant file
  4. change conflict vagrant name ip
  5. change 7.4 php in provisioning
  6. vagrant up
  7. create database
  8. import backup database to mysql
  9. composer install
  10. update.php

Update 8.8 or 8.9 to 9.2

  1. chmod 777 web/sites/default
  2. chmod 666 web/sites/default/*settings.php
  3. chmod 666 web/sites/default/*services.yml
  4. composer require 'drupal/core-recommended:^9' 'drupal/core-composer-scaffold:^9' 'drupal/core-project-message:^9' –update-with-dependencies –no-update
  5. composer update
  6. update.php
  7. if in case trouble in update.php such as module outdate
    1. https://www.drupal.org/docs/updating-drupal/troubleshooting-database-updates#s-the-module-or-theme-is-incompatible-with-the-installed-version-of-drupal
  8. chmod 755 web/sites/default
  9. chmod 644 web/sites/default/*settings.php
  10. chmod 644 web/sites/default/*services.yml

Update 8.0 to 9

hello.demo:
  title: 'Hello'
  description: 'Hello page'
  parent: main
  menu_name: main
  route_name: hello.content`
Let’s break this down.
  • hello.demo - the namespace for this menu link.
  • title - this will appear as the menu link
  • description - this will appear as the menu link title, a tooltip and/or the description in the admin UI.
  • parent - the parent item, which is used if you are adding this item as a child of another in a hierarchy. In this case the parent is the menu itself, so we are using the menu_name.
  • menu_name - this is the menu name we found in the previous step._
  • route_name - the route to call for this menu link.

Request not compatible in method

to use Request handler use 

Drupal::request()->query->all()
